body.name: Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - High Back Desk Chair with Adjustable Lumbar Support, Headrest & 3D Metal Armrest - 130° Rocking Mesh Computer Chair
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 1 hr 13 mins
features: 【Adjustable Mesh Chair】You can adjust lumbar support height and depth; headrest height and angle; armrest height, angle, forward & backward; seat cushion height; tilting angle up to 130°and rocking resilience to your personal most comfortable position

【Ergonomic Backrest & Seat】Our adjustable backrest can perfectly fit your spine and significantly ease the fatigue and pain of your back. Also, our seat is made of 3.5 inches high density foam with W-shaped and waterfall-edge design, providing larger support area and disperse pressure on hip and thighs

【Unique Metal Armrest】Compared with all other ergonomic desk chairs' plastic 1D armrest, our stainless electroplating metal 3D armrests with bigger, thicker & softer PU paddings are much more durable and best fit to your favorite position

【Unique Headrest & Quality Mesh】Our home office chairs' big curved foam headrest provides more comfortable neck and head support. Plus, our breathable mesh with strong tensile strength provides cool and comfortable back support, enabling long hours sitting relaxed without sweat

【Warranty】We provide 30 days money-back guarantee, one year warranty and professional after sales service for our ergonomic office chair. If there is any quality problem, please contact us and we will provide 100% satisfied solution. Our ergonomic computer chair has comprehensive packaging and clear instruction, enables everyone to assemble easily without damage worry. Our high back office chair passed BIFMA test and 1136 kg static pressure test

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Chair for the Price
reviews.reviewText: TLDR: Great chair for the price, highly recommend a few DIY fixes when assembling however.I have used the chair for the last three months, and can say for the price it's definitely a great chair. For about $130-$160 the chair has a lot of great features. The lumbar support is really nice and easy to adjust, the headrest is really good, the recline is easy to use and locks very nicely, the backrest feels really good and has not gotten loose on me, and the arm rests have a lot adjustability. I've known others who use chairs that are around $300-$500 and they say they actually prefer this one over theirs.There are a couple of problems I've had though. The seat can get uncomfortable, so I personally use a thin firm cushion that helps me sit in the chair for hours at a time. The recline on the chair is nice, however the adjustment for the force to sit back in the chair a bit more is quite difficult to use, and is not very intuitive on which direction is for strengthening the force for sitting back more, or lightening the load of it. The arm rests do have a fair bit of adjustability, however they do feel a bit too firm, and can cause some discomfort to my elbows at times. I do think adding a little bit extra padding from factory wouldn't add to the cost of manufacturing the chair very much, and if that is the case I would personally like some more padding in the arm rests.It's quite simple to assemble compared to other chairs I've had, however there are a few DIY fixes I highly recommend when assembling it. First, the cover that goes over where the chair legs and hydraulic lift for raising and lowering the chair meets will rattle a lot when moving the chair. What I did was use the foam from shipping, and cut a shape that will go on the underside of the cover so it does not rattle anymore. Second, after a month or so, I noticed a screw that had fallen off the chair, and the chair would creek a lot. When taking a look I noticed all the screws had backed out a considerable amount, and some were almost about to fall off as well. I ended up redoing all the screws with blue Loctite, and ever since all the screws have been firmly in place on the chair.Overall, even with a few complaints, the chair is definitely pretty good, and is great when factoring in the price. I highly recommend it if you're looking for an office chair in this price point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Extremely good value for money
reviews.reviewText: For what I paid for the chair, and for any chair under $200, this thing is WAY higher quality than I expected. Arms are very adjustable in a lot of ways, and has actual quality cushioning. Seat fabric also seems quite nice and less likely to break and fray. Only downside is that it's really not for leaning back at all - when it's in the locked position, you really are pretty straight up. I also remove the headrest as it was pushing my neck too far forward, but I have neck problems, so don't go by me. (It looks fine without the headrest, just treat it as a bonus.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - Comfortable Bliss on a Budget!
reviews.reviewText: Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ (5/5)As someone who spends long hours at a desk, finding the perfect office chair was a quest. Enter the Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair - a budget-friendly marvel that combines comfort and affordability like no other.Unparalleled Comfort: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️The level of comfort this chair provides is simply outstanding. The ergonomic design contours to my body, providing ample support for my back, shoulders, and neck. The breathable mesh back keeps me cool during extended work sessions, and the plush seat cushion feels like a dream.Adjustability Galore: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Customization is key, and the Ticova chair delivers in spades. The adjustable headrest, lumbar support, and armrests ensure that I can tailor the chair to my exact preferences. Finding the perfect ergonomic setup has never been easier.Quality Build at an Unbeatable Price: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️When it comes to affordability, Ticova hits the sweet spot. The chair's build quality is surprisingly sturdy, and it exudes a premium feel that you wouldn't expect at this price point. It's a true testament to getting more than you pay for.Smooth Mobility: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️The 360-degree swivel and smooth-rolling casters make maneuvering around my workspace effortless. Whether I'm reaching for documents or turning to grab a coffee, the chair moves with me, adding to the overall convenience.Easy Assembly: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Setting up the Ticova chair was a breeze. The instructions were clear, and all the necessary tools were provided. Within no time, I was enjoying the comfort of my new favorite office chair.Stylish and Professional: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️The Ticova chair doesn't just offer comfort; it looks good too. The sleek design and neutral color scheme add a touch of professionalism to my home office, making it a stylish addition to any workspace.In Conclusion:The Ticova Ergonomic Office Chair is a game-changer for those seeking comfort without breaking the bank. Its ergonomic features, quality build, and budget-friendly price tag make it a standout choice. Say goodbye to uncomfortable workdays and hello to affordable luxury with the Ticova chair. Your back will thank you! 💺✨

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 6’3”, 215lbs, chair works perfectly.
reviews.reviewText: Simple review here, the chair was easy to assemble and came in perfect condition. The seat is a bit stiff, but I assume with time it will loosen. The armrests are also pretty stiff, but I may not end up using them very often since I’ll rest my arms on my desk. Nothing here that would, at this point, take away from the rating.It feels very sturdy and as long as you don’t plan on body slamming into it, it should last a long time. I’m 215 lbs, so time will tell how harsh the weight is on the chair’s parts.For my height, the headrest is a bit low, but it works for the few times that I may actually be laying my head back on it (pretty seldom, I imagine).The ergonomic settings are perfectly serviceable, nothing ”luxury” but everything worked as advertised. As far as pictures, it looks exactly like it does in the ad, nothing of note to remark on.I’ll update the review as time goes on, this chair was assembled on 12 January, 2024.
La silla es como se muestra en la foto.Es perfecta para la espalda y cuello.El descansa brazos tiene posiciones.Valió la pena la compra.La recomiendo ampliamente.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bang for the buck ! Feels like 1000$ chair !
reviews.reviewText: its perfect ! Its sturdy its well build and feels very comfortable and its adjustable in every position.Worth every penny i would recommend this to anyone wanting a good ergonomic office chair for under 300$

Chaise très confortable, le cousin est moelleux même pour rester assis longtemps, et l'appuie tête est super bien pensé. Seul point négatif, le support de dos ressort trop a mon gout, et est un peut trop rigide pour ce que j'aurais voulus.Ca reste une super chaise pour le prix, confortable et facile à monter.
best chair for the price! i love it. i got mega-fast delivery. only 2 days during Christmas chaos

Por aprox. 149€, no se si existirá una silla que se dice ergonómica y que sea tan cómoda como esta. La conocí a través del Canal de Youtube Btod donde analizan sillas ergonómicas y pensaba que me iba a decepcionar, pero todo lo contrario. Los diferentes ajustes ergonómicos, algunos propios de un segmento más caro, hace que puedas ajustar la misma a tus formas sin problema, es razonablemente sencilla de montar, no es necesario que llames a nadie para que te la monte, en 20 0 30 min, puedes estar sentado cómodamente en ella, ahora a esperar que dure.¿Hay sillas mejores? Rotundamente sí, Herman Miller Aeron o Embody, Haworth Fern etc.. Estas dispuesto a pagar 1000€ por ellas, me lo tendría que pensar mucho...Muy buena compra...Saludos.
